CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph. I will present the valid entities in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |
| P3HT |
| PCZDTB |

The entities in the paragraph are:

* PQCDTB
* PC61BM
* PC71BM
* P3HT
* PCZDTB

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material Name":

* "PCZDTB" - This entity does not appear to be a material name.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Sure! Let's identify the property names in the paragraph. I will present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Here are the property names and their corresponding values from the paragraph:

| Property Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Device structure | As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 |
| Open-circuit voltage (V OC) | 0.76 V (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM), 0.79 V (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM) |
| Short-circuit current (J SC) | 4.4 mA cm^-2 (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM), 5.6 mA cm^-2 (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM) |
| Fill factor (FF) | 47.5% (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM), 55.8% (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM) |
| Power conversion efficiency (PCE) | 1.6% (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM), 56% (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM) |
| Photon absorption | PC71BM has a stronger UV-vis absorption property than PC61BM in the visible region, especially near 500 nm |
| Series resistance | 31 Ω/cm^2 (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM ratio of 1 : 1), 27 Ω/cm^2 (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1), 320 Ω/cm^2 (device with PCZDTB and PC61BM ratio of 1 : 1), 62 Ω/cm^2 (device with PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 4) |
| External quantum efficiency (EQE) | 38% (device with PQCDTB and PC61BM), 41% (device with PQCDTB and PC71BM) |
| λ max | -30 nm (device with PCZDTB) |

Note that some of the values are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed them once in the table for clarity.
